resource.string: Factions can develop the military buildings in both their provincial and regional capitals to increase the number of unit types available for recruitment.

Civilised factions can explore the military equipment chain at their provincial capital, growing beyond the humble workshop towards production on a larger scale that improves the production of arms and armour.
A faction can strengthen its military standing as a naval power or expand its trade and fishing output via the port building chain. Ports can be specialised accordingly.
A faction can strengthen its military standing as a naval power or expand its trade and fishing output via the port building chain. Ports can be specialised accordingly.

Civilised factions can explore the military equipment chain at their provincial capital, growing beyond the humble workshop towards production on a larger scale that improves the production of arms and armour.
By constructing buildings from the religious chain, civilised factions call on their deities to influence public order and cultural conversion, or even increase trade within a province.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.

Through discipline and training, an army can overcome seemingly insurmountable odds and endure lengthy campaigns in foreign lands. The training chain enables a faction to give their troops the skills they will require.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.

By constructing buildings from the religious chain, civilised factions call on their deities to influence public order and cultural conversion, or even increase trade within a province.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.
The agricultural chain enables the construction of buildings within the provincial or regional capital that specialise in manufacturing, farming or animal husbandry.

The city centre chain enables civilised factions to improve the facilities at their provincial capitals by choosing to develop trade and food production, or further exploit their slave workers.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.
The agricultural chain enables the construction of buildings within the provincial or regional capital that specialise in manufacturing, farming or animal husbandry.
Eastern factions can develop the military buildings in both their provincial and regional capitals to increase the number of cavalry and animal unit types available to be raised.
The agricultural chain enables the construction of buildings within the provincial or regional capital that specialise in manufacturing, farming or animal husbandry.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.

A civilization is judged by its levels of sanitation and hygiene: few look up to those who wallow in filth. This is reason enough for a faction to develop down the sanitation chain within its provincial capital, increasing both happiness and their cultural conversion rate.
The agricultural chain enables the construction of buildings within the provincial or regional capital that specialise in manufacturing, farming or animal husbandry.

By constructing buildings from the religious chain, tribal factions call on their deities to inspire happiness in their people, increase crop yields, and prepare their troops for battle.

The industrial chain enables the construction of buildings within the provincial or regional capital that specialise in manufacturing, farming or animal husbandry.
The capital chain is vital to both economic and population growth within your empire, helping to maximise income from local resources.

Tribal craftsmen played a vital role within their society. The industrial chain enables specialisation in wood, bronze, precious metals and salt across both major and minor settlements for the benefit of all.

A civilization is judged by its levels of sanitation and hygiene: few look up to those who wallow in filth. This is reason enough for a faction to develop down the sanitation chain within its provincial capital, increasing both happiness and their cultural conversion rate.
The city centre chain enables tribal factions to improve the facilities at their provincial capitals by choosing to develop agriculture and industry or further exploit their slave workers.
By constructing buildings from the religious chain, civilised factions call on their deities to influence public order and cultural conversion, or even increase trade within a province.
